feedback.question: What features of the product are most important to you?
feedback.results: The respondents generally valued flexibility and automation in the product. They appreciated flexible terms, automated savings plans, and savings challenges with rewards to help keep them motivated towards achieving goals. A competitive interest rate was also important to them. Additionally, financial education resources were seen as helpful tools to make informed decisions about managing finances. These features seemed to be common and very important to most respondents, especially those in professions related to technology, marketing, or entrepreneurship.

feedback.question: How frequently would you use this product?
What potential barriers do you see to using this product?
feedback.results: Potential barriers to using the proposed product include: high fees, high minimum deposit requirements, uncompetitive interest rates, complicated or time-consuming setup processes, difficulty or lack of flexibility in withdrawing funds, reliance on automated transfers, penalties for frequent withdrawals, lack of motivation from savings challenges and rewards, and preference for more traditional savings accounts. These barriers seem to be prevalent and important in the responses, indicating that they should be addressed in order to attract new members and expand deposit products. Overall, customers are looking for user-friendly, flexible products with competitive returns, transparent fees, and engaging savings challenges and education resources.

feedback.question: Would you be more likely to use this product if it had a rewards program?
feedback.results: Most survey respondents indicated that they would be more likely to use the product if it had a rewards program, with many emphasizing the importance of meaningful and relevant rewards. Challenges and milestones were also noted as motivators for some participants, along with the desire for recognition of achievements. Additional bonuses such as cashback or discounts on other products or services were also mentioned as enticing incentives. Overall, creating an attractive rewards program appears to be a popular and effective way to encourage users to save more and achieve their financial goals.

feedback.question: On a scale of 1-10, how important is the interest rate for this product to you?
What benefits do you see in this product that are not offered by other financial institutions?
feedback.results: The responses generally show that the standout features of the product that are not offered by many other financial institutions include unique savings challenges and rewards, financial education resources such as webinars and articles, penalty-free withdrawals once per year, flexible terms and rollovers into new savings plans. Savings challenges and rewards were often mentioned as a benefit that sets this product apart from others in the market and helps keep consumers motivated. Other cited benefits include financial education resources, penalties and withdrawal options that offer more flexibility to members than traditional savings accounts. Overall, the combination of these unique features appear to set the product apart and could be attractive to potential members.

feedback.question: Would you be more likely to use this product if there was a mobile app available?
feedback.results: The majority of respondents stated that they would be more likely to use the product if there was a mobile app available. Many individuals, particularly those with software engineering or development backgrounds, cited the convenience of accessing their account information and managing their savings on-the-go as a key factor in their decision. Having the ability to set up automated transfers, participate in savings challenges, and access financial education resources from their phone was also mentioned as important. Analysts rated the importance of a mobile app for the product as a 9 and an 8 out of 10, respectively.

feedback.question: On a scale of 1-10, how likely are you to recommend this product to a family member?
What features of the product are most important to you?
feedback.results: The majority of respondents value the automatic savings feature of the Round-Up Savings product, as it is convenient and takes the effort out of saving money. They also appreciated the flexibility in transfer options and competitive interest rates. Having an easy-to-use and time-saving product is important for software engineers and developers. Flexibility and convenience are key factors for busy professionals, business owners, and real estate agents. The presence of competitive interest rates is always a plus. Overall, the automatic savings feature appears to be the most important for consumers.

feedback.question: How frequently would you use this product?
What potential barriers do you see to using this product?
feedback.results: The potential barriers identified by members include concerns about the security or privacy of linking their debit card to their credit union account, hesitation to rely on automatic transfers, skepticism of whether the interest rates offered are enough to incentivize usage, fear of overdrafting their checking account, desire for more control and customization over transfer thresholds and frequencies, uncertainty about fees and penalties associated with the product, and lack of awareness or complications with the enrollment process. These barriers appear to be prevalent among the responses and may need to be addressed in order to effectively promote and attract new members with this product.

feedback.question: Would you be more likely to use this product if it had a rewards program?
feedback.results: The responses to the question about adding a rewards program to the deposit product appear overwhelmingly positive. Most respondents indicate that they would be more likely to use the product if it had a rewards program that incentivized them to save more money. Typical rewards programs suggested include cashback, points, or discounts on purchases, and rewards should be meaningful and aligned with the consumer's interests and values. Furthermore, respondents also note that the security and transparency of the program is equally essential. Overall, adding a rewards program could significantly increase the appeal of the deposit product.

feedback.question: On a scale of 1-10, how important is the interest rate for this product to you?
What benefits do you see in this product that are not offered by other financial institutions?
feedback.results: In general, respondents are most excited about the automatic savings feature of Round-Up Savings. They appreciate how it makes saving money effortless and how it automatically transfers the rounded-up amount into their savings account. Additionally, the flexible transfer options, ability to set personal savings goals and customizable transfer threshold, and competitive interest rates were all appealing features as well. Overall, these benefits set the product apart from more traditional savings products offered by financial institutions.

feedback.question: Would you be more likely to use this product if there was a mobile app available?
feedback.results: The majority of respondents indicated that having a mobile app available for the Round-Up Savings product would make them more likely to use it. The convenience of being able to track savings progress, adjust transfer settings, and monitor account activity on-the-go was cited as a major selling point by many respondents. Some also suggested specific features they would like in the app, such as real-time balance updates, transaction history, and the ability to set savings goals and transfer thresholds. The importance of a mobile app was given a rating of 9 out of 10 by one respondent. Overall, the feedback emphasizes the significance of a mobile app in attracting and retaining customers for this product.

feedback.question: On a scale of 1-10, how likely are you to recommend this product to a family member?
What features of the product are most important to you?
feedback.results: The survey responses highlight that the most important features of the proposed deposit product are the automatic savings transfers based on personalized savings goals and the monthly challenges with rewards for meeting savings milestones, which make saving money more engaging and motivating. The tiered interest rates based on length of time money is saved also seemed to be a popular feature, as it provides an incentive to save for longer periods of time while earning higher interest rates. Access to financial education resources and tools were mentioned frequently as an added benefit, which would help members make informed financial decisions. The responses from software engineers and developers emphasize the importance of convenience and automation in the product. Overall, the personalization, engagement features, and incentives seem to be key takeaways from the survey responses.

feedback.question: How frequently would you use this product?
What potential barriers do you see to using this product?
feedback.results:
The surveyed respondents identified several potential barriers to using the proposed Savings Challenge Account product. Key takeaways include:
- A high minimum deposit or account balance could be a barrier for some potential users.
- Rewards for meeting savings milestones need to be appealing and motivating.
- The user interface needs to be user-friendly and intuitive.
- Interest rates offered need to be competitive with other savings accounts in the market.
- Monthly challenges should be engaging and not too difficult or unrealistic.
- The product should be marketed effectively, easy to use/navigate and the financial education resources and tools should provide valuable information.
- Busy schedules may make it challenging to actively participate in monthly savings challenges.
Overall, the responses show that the important factors are competitiveness, ease-of-use, convenience and meaningful rewards for achievements without the added unfeasible expectations imposed on them regularly which may lead to guilt.

feedback.question: Would you be more likely to use this product if it had a rewards program?
feedback.results: The majority of respondents expressed that they would be more likely to use the product if it had a rewards program. The potential rewards mentioned include bonus interest, cash bonuses, discounts on other products/services, and even recognition and achievements. Meaningful and well-aligned rewards seem to be important for motivating users and keeping them engaged with the product. Respondents also mentioned that a well-designed rewards program could make the process of saving money more fun and engaging. Several respondents noted that they are motivated by challenges and the monthly savings milestones can serve as an incentive, but they would be even more interested in additional rewards. Overall, a rewards program is seen as a valuable way to incentivize users and attract new members to the credit union.

feedback.question: On a scale of 1-10, how important is the interest rate for this product to you?
What benefits do you see in this product that are not offered by other financial institutions?
feedback.results: The responses highlight several unique features of the Savings Challenge Account, including personalized savings goals and monthly challenges with rewards that help motivate consumers to save. The availability of financial education resources and tools is also highly valued by participants. Additionally, tiered interest rates based on the length of time money is saved are seen as an appealing way to incentivize saving for longer periods of time. Collectively, these features seem to make the account a compelling and innovative option for consumers looking to improve their financial literacy and reach their savings goals. The feedback suggests that these particular features may be the key selling points in marketing the product to new members.

feedback.question: Would you be more likely to use this product if there was a mobile app available?
feedback.results: The vast majority of respondents (12 out of 13) indicated that having a mobile app available would make them more likely to use the Savings Challenge Account product. The key benefits they identified were convenience and accessibility, allowing them to track their savings progress, participate in challenges, and access financial education resources on-the-go. The overwhelming response suggests that offering a mobile app could be a crucial factor in attracting new members to the credit union and expanding its deposit products.

feedback.question: On a scale of 1-10, how likely are you to recommend this product to a family member?
